text: Gujarmal Modi 9 August 1902  22 January 1976 was an Indian industrialist and philanthropist, who co-established the Modi Group of companies and the industrial city of Modinagar in 1933, along with his brother Kedar Nath Modi
1 A sugar mill in Modinagar marked the beginning of the Modi Group conglomerate, which later diversified into varied fields
GM Modi established schools and colleges at his birthplace, Mahendragarh, in Patiala and in Modinagar
“Narendra Modi is forcing a war between India and Pakistan for his own political gains”

But now that Narendra Modi is setting a new trend, by retaliating every time an attack is done on India , they cannot understand why is Modi retaliating instead of following the same procedure done by the previous governments, they are stating it as “Narendra Modi is forcing a war between India and Pakistan for his own political gains”
And moreover Modi has got nothing to do with the war, he didn’t call for a war, Pakistan did

Modi didn’t call for the war, all he did is planned to take down terrorist camps in Balakot, and that’s what every country which feels that “terrorism is a threat to world peace and Pakistan is inefficient in stopping the terrorism” should do
In the first place Prime Minister Modi is not forcing any war between India and Pakistan, so their wont be any question about political gains

Id totally agree with your statement, and even PM Modi know that and doesnt want to go to war with pakistan and that is the reason why he hasnt attacked pakistan or waged a full scale war against pakistan instead he choose to attack a terrorist base camp which happen to be located in Pakistan
And some people are stating that the incidents of Uri and Pulwama occurred because of PM Modi
“If not for Modi, those terror attacks would have occurred in middle of the country instead of places close to border or places close to Pok”

Ps- I have no intentions of politicising this matter and I know that credit for decresing the terror attacks in India goes to the Intelligence deparment and security forces of India and not the prime minister, i just want to state that putting the blame of every terror attack on Modi, like no terror attacks happened any other time and calling everyone who supports Modi as a bakth, isnt helping anyone
Priyanka Vadra becomes Congress President
Edit To anyone who thinks Indiaor Modi is forcing a war, no, India is not
Under Narendra Modi’s leadership Gujarat was known for its development oriented governance where the people were made active partners and stakeholders in the development journey
When Narendra Modi took over as the Chief Minister Gujarat was reeling under the effects of a devastating Earthquake

Everyone thought the damage in Gujarat would take years to be undone but Narendra Modi and his team proved everyone wrong by putting Gujarat on the path to recovery and development in a record time of under three years
Under Chief Minister Narendra Modi, the farmers of Gujarat witnessed unprecedented prosperity
Narendra Modi devoted special attention towards the healthcare and education sector

Since 2004 the Shala Praveshotsav and Kanya Kelavani Drive are undertaken by every Government official including the Chief Minister went to the villages of Gujarat asking parents to send their children to school
This has received phenomenal results as the school dropout ratios have dropped considerably since the time when Narendra Modi took office
A firm believer in youth-led development, Narendra Modi devoted a lot of efforts towards enhancing skill development among the youth
Infact, Gujarat’s Kaushalya Vardhan Kendras were awarded the Prime Minister’s Award for Excellence in Public Administration in 2013
Virali Modi1 born 29 September 1991 is a disability rights activist from India
History was scripted in the forecourt of Rashtrapati Bhawan on the evening of 26th May 2014 as Narendra Modi took oath as the Prime Minister of India after a historic mandate from the people of India
In Narendra Modi, the people of India see a dynamic, decisive and development-oriented leader who has emerged as a ray of hope for the dreams and aspirations of a billion Indians

His focus on development, eye for detail and efforts to bring a qualitative difference in the lives of the poorest of the poor have made Narendra Modi a popular and respected leader across the length and breadth of India
Narendra Modi’s life has been a journey of courage, compassion and constant hardwork

He displayed his skills as a grass root level worker, an organiser and an administrator during his 13 year long stint as the Chief Minister of his home state of Gujarat, where he ushered a paradigm shift towards pro-people and pro-active good governance
Narendra Modi’s inspiring life journey to the Office of Prime Minister began in the by-lanes of Vadnagar, a small town in North Gujarat’s Mehsana district
This makes him the first Prime Minister to be born in independent India
Modi is the third child born to Damodardas Modi and Hiraba Modi

Narendra Modi’s formative years taught him early tough lessons as he balanced his studies, non-academic life to spare time to work at the family owned Tea Stall as the family struggled to make ends meet
Modi’s thoughts and dreams as a child were quite removed from how most children of his age thought
It was a tough routine for Narendra Modi in Ahmedabad since 1972 when he became a Pracharak for RSS
Late 1970s also saw a young Narendra Modi join the movement to restore Democracy in India which was reeling under Emergency
While continuing to shoulder different responsibilities within the Sangh during the 1980s Narendra Modi emerged as an Organizer exemplar with his organizing skills
CM Narendra Modi when he started work as the General Secretary of the BJP in Gujarat
CM Modi won a victory for the BJP in Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation elections for the first time ever
Modi’s organizational skills ensured the BJP’s vote share increased and the party won 121 seats in the Assembly
To read more about Shri Narendra Modi’s personal life story please visit
Narendra Damodardas Modi Gujarati pronunciation born 17 September 1950 is an Indian politician serving as the 14th and current Prime Minister of India since 2014
He was the Chief Minister of Gujarat from 2001 to 2014, and is the Member of Parliament for Varanasi
Modi is a member of the Bharatiya Janata Party BJP, and of the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh RSS, a Hindu nationalist volunteer organisation
Born to a Gujarati family in Vadnagar, Modi helped his father sell tea as a child, and has said he later ran his own stall
Modi is the third child born to Damodardas Modi and Hiraba Modi
Modi is the third child born to Damodardas Modi and Hiraba Modi
During the state of emergency imposed across the country in 1975, Modi was forced to go into hiding
A Supreme Court-appointed Special Investigation Team found no evidence to initiate prosecution proceedings against Modi personally
Minister Modi led the BJP in the 2014 general election, which gave the party a majority in the Indian lower house of parliament, the Lok Sabha, the first time for any single party since 1984
Modis administration has tried to raise foreign direct investment in the Indian economy, and reduced spending on healthcare and social welfare programmes
Modi has attempted to improve efficiency in the bureaucracy he has centralised power by abolishing the Planning Commission

Described as engineering a political realignment towards right-wing politics, Modi remains a figure of controversy domestically and internationally over his Hindu nationalist beliefs and his role during the 2002 Gujarat riots, cited as evidence of an exclusionary social agenda
In June 1975, Prime Minister Indira Gandhi declared a state of emergency in India which lasted until 1977
1959 Modi was appointed general secretary of the Gujarat Lok Sangharsh Samiti, an RSS committee coordinating opposition to the Emergency in Gujarat
As Chief Minister, Modi favoured privatisation and small government, which was at odds with the philosophy of the RSS, usually described as anti-privatisation and anti-globalisation
The governments led by Patel and Modi supported NGOs and communities in the creation of groundwater-conservation projects
151 In 2008 Chief Minister Modi offered land in Gujarat to Tata Motors to set up a plant manufacturing the Nano after a popular agitation had forced the company to move out of West Bengal
A contentious debate surrounds the assessment of Gujarats economic development during Modis tenure as chief minister
154 The states GDP growth rate averaged 10 during Modis tenure,
